title: King Charles taken to hospital after cancer treatment 'bump in the road'

Trump reverses termination of program tracking mass child abductions in Ukraine
description: The rare reversal of a Trump administration edict terminating a program to track mass child abductions in Ukraine follows a Washington Post report and concerns from U.S. lawmakers and Christian evangelicals.
author: John Hudson

title: Tourist submarine sinks off Egypt’s Red Sea coast, killing at least 6
description: The submarine, carrying 45 tourists, sank about a half-mile off the coast of Egypt.
author: Mikhail Klimentov

title: Six Russian tourists dead after submarine sinks in Red Sea, Egyptian officials say – as it happened
description: Incident took place near the popular Egyptian Red Sea resort of HurghadaThe Russian consulate in Hurghada said the submarine, named “SINDBAD”, had 45 Russian tourists on board in addition to crew members.The consulate said four people had died, but did not specify if they were Russian, Reuters reported.Six people have died and nine others are injured after a tourist submarine sank in the popular Egyptian Red Sea destination of Hurghada, two municipal officials said. AP reported that the officials were speaking on condition of anonymity because they were not authorised to brief the media.The incident, involving a recreational vessel operated by Sindbad Submarines, occurred in waters opposite Hurghada’s Marriot Hotel resort. Citing municipal officials, Reuters and Associated Press reported that six foreigners, whose nationalities are still unknown, had died. It was not immediately clear what caused the submarine to sink.The Russian embassy in Egypt has said that that all of the tourists on board the submarine were Russian. It said 45 passengers were on board the vessel, including children, in a Facebook post.The local governorate’s office told Reuters that all of those confirmed dead were foreign citizens, while survivors had been ferried by ambulance to several hospitals in the city. Emergency crews were able to rescue 29 people, according to a statement released by the governorate. Many tourist companies have stopped or limited travelling on the Red Sea due to the dangers from conflicts in the region.The Sindbad club’s website says it offers short tourist trips in two submarines that it operates that have a maximum depth range of 25 metres. According to the website its submarines allow tourists to “experience the beauty of the Red Sea’s underwater world without getting wet”. Continue reading...

title: Six Russian tourists die after submarine sinks off Egypt coast
description: Another 39 people rescued and brought to shore after incident on vessel at Red Sea resortSix Russian tourists have died and 39 people have been rescued after a submarine sank near the resort of Hurghada, the latest in a series of fatal accidents involving tourists on Egypt’s Red Sea coast.Four survivors, including at least one child, were admitted to intensive care, according to an official statement. Continue reading...
author: Peter Beaumont and agencies

title: Putin says Greenland 'nothing to do with Russia' in nod to US
description: Speaking in the Arctic, Russia's president said Trump's plans were "serious" but nothing to do with Moscow.

title: Canada PM Mark Carney says old relationship with US 'is over'
description: The Canadian leader said his country's relationship with the US had changed due to Trump's tariffs, jeopardising future cooperation.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: What ails India's manufacturing?
description: India wants to be a manufacturing powerhouse. A flagship scheme launched five years ago to help the country realize that aim, however, has fallen short of key goals.

title: Alibaba has staged a quiet $100 billion rally — AI and Jack Ma's return are at the heart of it
description: Alibaba founder Jack Ma has returned to the spotlight as China's political environment for tech improves. Alibaba's successes in AI have also shone through.

title: Drones, Mines and Snipers: Ukraine’s Front Line Is a World Away from Peace Talks
description: For soldiers and commanders on the edge of battle, any talk about a lasting cease-fire still feels like a dangerous fantasy.
author: Marc Santora, Liubov Sholudko and Nicole Tung

title: Europeans Vow to Stand by Ukraine, but Disagree Over Force Proposal
description: After a “coalition of the willing” gathering in Paris, President Emmanuel Macron insisted that a “reassurance force” of European troops after the war ends was still on the table. But details remained scarce.
author: Aurelien Breeden

title: King Charles Hospitalised Over 'Side Effects' From Cancer Treatment
description: Britain's King Charles III on Thursday was forced to cancel his appointments for the rest of the day and Friday after suffering "side effects" from his cancer treatment, Buckingham Palace said.

title: Israel Parliament Expands Political Control Over Judicial Appointments
description: Israel's parliament passed a law on Thursday expanding the power of politicians over the appointment of judges in defiance of a years-long protest movement against the judicial reforms pushed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
